etymology.description: 武昌 + 起义 = uprising that occurred in Wuchang.
etymology.interpretation: Names the 1911 uprising that began in Wuchang and ignited the Xinhai Revolution. It became the catalyst for the fall of the Qing dynasty.
etymology.simplification: 起義 → 起义: 義 was simplified to 义 during script reform to reduce strokes; 武昌 unchanged.

parts.english: Wuchang (place name); former city in Hubei; district of Wuhan

examples.chinese: 武昌起义爆发于1911年10月10日(武昌起義爆發於1911年10月10日)。
examples.pinyin: Wǔchāng Qǐyì bàofā yú yījiǔyīyī nián shí yuè shí rì.
examples.english: The Wuchang Uprising broke out on October 10, 1911.

examples.chinese: 它引发了辛亥革命并推翻清朝(它引發了辛亥革命並推翻清朝)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐnfā le Xīnhài Gémìng bìng tuīfān Qīngcháo.
examples.english: It triggered the Xinhai Revolution and overthrew the Qing dynasty.

examples.chinese: 名称来自湖北武汉的武昌区(名稱來自湖北武漢的武昌區)。
examples.pinyin: Míngchēng láizì Húběi Wǔhàn de Wǔchāng Qū.
examples.english: The name comes from Wuchang District in Wuhan, Hubei.
